intro: Silaum besseri, commonly known as Bessera silaum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Silaum besseri is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand cold and harsh environmental conditions.
